meanings.definition: A person who participates in a stampede.
meanings.sent1: During the stampede, the stampeder ran with the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The stampeder joined the group in a rush of movement.
meanings.sent3: The stampeder in the herd was eager to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent4: Like a stampeder chasing after a goal, he hurried along with determination.
meanings.sent5: The stampeder's presence added to the chaos of the stampede.

meanings.definition: A participant in a sudden, frenzied rush of activity.
meanings.sent1: When the announcement was made, the stampeder hurried to get in line.
meanings.sent2: The stampeder eagerly joined the group in their sudden rush.
meanings.sent3: In the office, the stampeder raced to finish the task first.
meanings.sent4: Like a stampeder in a race, she dashed towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The stampeder's energy fueled the frenzied activity around them.

meanings.definition: To take part in a stampede.
meanings.sent1: The animals stampedered through the narrow passage.
meanings.sent2: People stampedered towards the exit when the alarm sounded.
meanings.sent3: He stampedered into the store to catch the sale before it ended.
meanings.sent4: The crowd stampedered out of the stadium after the game.
meanings.sent5: She stampedered through the crowd to catch up with her friends.
